title: Sophia Yi
text:
Sophia Yi is a 4th year undergraduate student at UCLA, studying Statistics & Data Science and Spanish. Her interests are in Biostatistics and public health. In her free time, she enjoys cafe-hopping and digital art (check out her Redbubble below!)

title: Recent Projects
text: My final group project in Stats 140XP examined how debt delinquency rates vary within socioeconomic and demographic characteristics, with particular attention to childhood family income. Read our final report here

title: Recent Projects
section: Heavy-Tailed Reward Distributions for Multiplayer Bandits (April 2025)
text:
Heavy-Tailed Reward Distributions for Multiplayer Bandits (April 2025)
This paper explores the multi-arm bandit problem and extends the study of heavy-tailed bandits to the multi-agent setting, where multiple players interact in environments with varying levels of information asymmetry. Read more about our paper here

title: Recent Projects
section: Coordinating for Clicks: Learning in Multi-Agent Information Asymmetric Cascading Bandits (Feb 2025)
text:
Coordinating for Clicks: Learning in Multi-Agent Information Asymmetric Cascading Bandits (Feb 2025)
This paper builds on the decentralized, cooperative multi-agent bandit framework and apply it to the previously researchedstochastic partial-monitoring cascading bandit problem. We contend with three variants of information asymmetry: action asymmetry, reward asymmetry, and that with both action and reward asymmetry. Read more about our paper here
